intro: Polygala labatii, commonly known as the mountain polygala, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, with a distinctive spurred shape that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Polygala labatii is considered a rare and endangered species.
